metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1372 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ClamAV (aka Clam AntiVirus) before 0.99.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted 7z file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-base - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamdscan - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
